text: Anthurium plantagineum is a species of plant in the family Araceae. It is endemic to Ecuador. Its natural habitat is subtropical or tropical moist lowland forests. It is threatened by habitat loss. The Latin specific epithet plantagineum refers to the leaves of the plant which are similar to those of a plantain.W. T. Parsons, William Thomas Parsons and E. G. Cuthbertson ==References== Category:Endemic flora of Ecuador plantagineum Category:Data deficient plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Anthurium plantagineum
